articles.headline: In China, G.M. Remains a Driving Force
articles.snippet: G.M.’s China division emphasizes fuel-sipping models instead of gas guzzlers, putting it ahead of Ford.
articles.abstract: G.M.’s China division emphasizes fuel-sipping models instead of gas guzzlers, putting it ahead of Ford.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Ford may be standing taller than General Motors in Detroit these days — flush with cash while its rival is forced to go repeatedly to Washington, hat in hand, seeking government bailouts. But in China the tables are turned.

articles.headline: Wider Drug War Threatens Colombian Indians
articles.snippet: Indigenous groups have been displaced by armed men seeking control of regions coveted in the drug trade.
articles.abstract: Indigenous groups have been displaced by armed men seeking control of regions coveted in the drug trade.
articles.lead_paragraph: NUNCIDO, Colombia — Up and down the rivers of western Colombia, a new breed of criminal armies is pressing deeper into this isolated jungle, fighting with guerrillas for control of the cocaine trade and forcing thousands of Indians to flee.

articles.headline: For Housing Crisis, the End Probably Isn’t Near
articles.snippet: Two auctions, one in Washington and one in Miami, suggest that real estate prices have not bottomed out.
articles.abstract: Two auctions, one in Washington and one in Miami, suggest that real estate prices have not bottomed out.
articles.lead_paragraph: The closest thing to a real estate crystal ball in the last few years has been the house auctions that are regularly held around the country.

articles.headline: He’s Behind the Guffaws and the Gore
articles.snippet: Clinton R. Culpepper is the producer behind many of the genre movies that have become consistent money-makers for the Screen Gems unit of Sony Pictures Entertainment.
articles.abstract: Clinton R. Culpepper is the producer behind many of the genre movies that have become consistent money-makers for the Screen Gems unit of Sony Pictures Entertainment.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — If the stalker thriller “Obsessed,” which opens on Friday, tops the box office, Clinton R. Culpepper will cement his reputation as Hollywood’s king of the schlockbuster.

articles.headline: Banks Sway Bills to Aid Consumers
articles.snippet: With efforts to help homeowners and credit card holders in jeopardy, Democrats call on President Obama to put pressure on lenders.
articles.abstract: With efforts to help homeowners and credit card holders in jeopardy, Democrats call on President Obama to put pressure on lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  They may be held in low esteem around the nation, but the country’s largest banks still wield considerable influence in Washington.
articles.byline: By Stephen Labaton and Eric Dash

articles.headline: In Adopting Harsh Tactics, No Look at Past Use
articles.snippet: Top U.S. officials involved in the adoption of brutal interrogation methods did not investigate the origins of the techniques they approved with little debate.
articles.abstract: Top U.S. officials involved in the adoption of brutal interrogation methods did not investigate the origins of the techniques they approved with little debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The program began with Central Intelligence Agency leaders in the grip of an alluring idea: They could get tough in terrorist interrogations without risking legal trouble by adopting a set of methods used on Americans during military training. How could that be torture?
articles.byline: By Scott Shane and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: U.S. in Standoff With Banks Over Chrysler
articles.snippet: Big lenders have resisted demands from the Obama administration to restructure Chrysler’s debt.
articles.abstract: Big lenders have resisted demands from the Obama administration to restructure Chrysler’s debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  The Obama administration has entered a tense showdown with several of the nation’s largest banks that appears likely to determine whether Chrysler survives.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Quadrangle Facing Questions Over Pension Funds
articles.snippet: Steven Rattner’s investment company is one of several caught up in an inquiry into corruption in pension funds.
articles.abstract: Steven Rattner’s investment company is one of several caught up in an inquiry into corruption in pension funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two months after Steven Rattner left Wall Street for Washington, his private investment company is facing a widening investigation into corruption in public pension funds  and fighting for its future.

articles.headline: Reported Suicide Is Latest Shock at Freddie Mac
articles.snippet: David B. Kellermann, the troubled mortgage giant’s acting chief financial officer, reportedly hanged himself.
articles.abstract: David B. Kellermann, the troubled mortgage giant’s acting chief financial officer, reportedly hanged himself.
articles.lead_paragraph: The pressures were already immense when David B. Kellermann was promoted to the top financial position at the mortgage giant Freddie Mac last September. Then they got even worse.
articles.byline: By Charles Duhigg and Jack Healy
